id: tabindex_no_positive
title: tabindex_no_positive
custom_edit_url: https://github.com/thibaudcolas/curlylint/edit/main/curlylint/rules/tabindex_no_positive/tabindex_no_positive.py
---

import Tabs from "@theme/Tabs";
import TabItem from "@theme/TabItem";
import CodeSnippet from "@theme/CodeSnippet";

> Prevents using positive `tabindex` values, which are very easy to misuse with problematic consequences for keyboard users.
>
> User impact: **Serious**

This rule supports the following configuration:

<Tabs
  groupId="config-language"
  defaultValue="toml"
  values={[
    { label: "TOML", value: "toml" },
    { label: "Shell", value: "shell" },
  ]}
>
  <TabItem value="toml">
    <CodeSnippet
      snippet={`# Avoid positive \`tabindex\` values, change the order of elements on the page instead.\ntabindex_no_positive = true`}
      annotations={[]}
      lang="toml"
    />
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="shell">
    <CodeSnippet
      snippet={`# Avoid positive \`tabindex\` values, change the order of elements on the page instead.\ncurlylint --rule 'tabindex_no_positive: true' .`}
      annotations={[]}
      lang="shell"
    />
  </TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Success

<Tabs
  groupId="config-language"
  defaultValue="toml"
  values={[
    { label: "TOML", value: "toml" },
    { label: "Shell", value: "shell" },
  ]}
>
  <TabItem value="toml">
    <CodeSnippet
      snippet={`<!-- Good: No tabindex attribute – rely on the order of elements -->\n<!-- tabindex_no_positive = true -->\n<input type="text" name="username" />\n<!-- Good: Not recommended but valid -->\n<!-- tabindex_no_positive = true -->\n<div role="button" tabindex="0">ARIA button</div>\n<!-- Good: Use -1 where appropriate, so elements can programmatically receive focus -->\n<!-- tabindex_no_positive = true -->\n<div tabindex="-1">I can receive focus via JS</div>`}
      annotations={[]}
      lang="html"
    />
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="shell">
    <CodeSnippet
      snippet={`<!-- Good: No tabindex attribute – rely on the order of elements -->\n<!-- curlylint --rule 'tabindex_no_positive: true' . -->\n<input type="text" name="username" />\n<!-- Good: Not recommended but valid -->\n<!-- curlylint --rule 'tabindex_no_positive: true' . -->\n<div role="button" tabindex="0">ARIA button</div>\n<!-- Good: Use -1 where appropriate, so elements can programmatically receive focus -->\n<!-- curlylint --rule 'tabindex_no_positive: true' . -->\n<div tabindex="-1">I can receive focus via JS</div>`}
      annotations={[]}
      lang="html"
    />
  </TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Fail

<Tabs
  groupId="config-language"
  defaultValue="toml"
  values={[
    { label: "TOML", value: "toml" },
    { label: "Shell", value: "shell" },
  ]}
>
  <TabItem value="toml">
    <CodeSnippet
      snippet={`<!-- Bad: Positive values are problematic -->\n<!-- tabindex_no_positive = true -->\n<button type="submit" tabindex="3">Sign in</button>\n\n`}
      annotations={[{"file": "test.html", "column": 1, "line": 3, "code": "tabindex_no_positive", "message": "Avoid positive `tabindex` values, change the order of elements on the page instead"}]}
      lang="html"
    />
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="shell">
    <CodeSnippet
      snippet={`<!-- Bad: Positive values are problematic -->\n<!-- curlylint --rule 'tabindex_no_positive: true' . -->\n<button type="submit" tabindex="3">Sign in</button>\n\n`}
      annotations={[{"file": "test.html", "column": 1, "line": 3, "code": "tabindex_no_positive", "message": "Avoid positive `tabindex` values, change the order of elements on the page instead"}]}
      lang="html"
    />
  </TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Resources

- [WHATWG HTML Standard, The autofocus attribute](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/interaction.html#attr-fe-autofocus)
- [The accessibility of HTML 5 autofocus](https://www.brucelawson.co.uk/2009/the-accessibility-of-html-5-autofocus/)
- [MDN: input `autofocus` attribute usage considerations](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#htmlattrdefautofocus)
